fnd21_allcategories_insight_accessandaff.description: Insight score derived for news articles relevant to Access and Affordability category for any company. This news topic addresses companies' ability to ensure equal access to their products and services and that products and services are priced fairly, in particular in the context of underserved markets. Issues include those related to universal needs such as access to health care, financial services, education, and telecommunications

Percentile calculated within the SICS industry of a company for the insight score derived from news articles relevant to Access and Affordability category for any company. This news topic addresses companies' ability to ensure equal access to their products and services and that products and services are priced fairly, in particular in the context of underserved markets. Issues include those related to universal needs such as access to health care, financial services, education, and telecommunications.

fnd21_allcategories_insight_accidentands.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to the Accident and Safety Management category of any company. This topic addresses the corporate use of management systems and scenario planning to identify and understand exposure to possible catastrophic risks and prevent the occurrence of low probability, high impact accidents and emergencies. It relates to the culture of safety at a company, management systems and technological controls, potential human safety, environmental health, and social implications of these events occurring, and the long-term effects to an organization, its workers, and society should these events occur.

%ile calculated within SICS industry of a company from insight scores derived from news articles relevant to the Accident and Safety Management category of any company. This topic addresses the corporate use of management systems and scenario planning to identify and understand exposure to possible catastrophic risks and prevent the occurrence of low probability, high-impact accidents and emergencies. It relates to the culture of safety at a company, management systems and technological controls, potential human safety, environmental health, and social implications of these events occurring, and the long-term effects to an organization, its workers, and society should these events occur.

fnd21_allcategories_insight_allcategorie.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to all the ESG categories of any company.

fnd21_allcategories_insight_biodiversity.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to the Biodiversity Impact of any company. This topic addresses impacts on ecosystems and biodiversity. This includes, but is not limited to, aspects of land use, ecosystem service benefits, biodiversity loss and habitat destruction, and deforestation. This topic relates to all stages of a company's interaction with ecosystems including planning, land acquisition, permitting, development, operations, and site remediation.

fnd21_allcategories_insight_businessethi.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to Business Ethics and Transparency of Payments category of any company. This topic relates to risks and opportunities surrounding ethical conduct of business, including fraud, corruption, bribery and facilitation payments, fiduciary responsibilities, and other illegal behavior that may have an ethical component. This includes sensitivity to business norms and standards as they shift over time, jurisdiction, and culture.

fnd21_allcategories_insight_datasecurity.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to the Data Security and Customer Privacy category of any company. This topic addresses risks related to a company's management of sensitive, confidential, and/or proprietary data. This includes safekeeping of customer data. It relates to technology practices, training, record keeping, cooperation with law enforcement, and other mechanisms used to ensure privacy and security.

fnd21_allcategories_insight_diversityand.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to the Diversity and Inclusion category of any company. fnd21_allcategories_insight_employeeheal.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to Employee Health Safety and Well Being category of any company. This topic addresses a company's ability to maintain a safe and healthy workplace environment. This includes creating a workplace free of injuries, fatalities, and illness (both chronic and acute, and physical and mental health) through technology, training, corporate culture, regulatory compliance, monitoring and testing, and personal protective equipment.

This includes creating a workplace free of injuries, fatalities, and illness (both chronic and acute, and physical and mental health) through technology, training, corporate culture, regulatory compliance, monitoring and testing, and personal protective equipment.

fnd21_allcategories_insight_energymanage.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to Energy Management category of any company. This topic addresses indirect (Scope 2) greenhouse gas emissions through management of the use of energy in manufacturing and/or for the provision of products and services. It includes energy efficiency and intensity, energy mix, grid reliance, and other factors.

%ile within SICS industry for a company derived from insight scores calculated from news articles relevant to Energy Management category of any company. This topic addresses indirect (Scope 2) greenhouse gas emissions through management of the use of energy in manufacturing and/or for the provision of products and services. fnd21_allcategories_insight_fairdisclosu.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to Fair Disclosure and Labeling category of any company. This topic addresses transparency, accuracy, and comprehensibility of marketing statements, advertising, and labeling of products and services. This includes, but is not limited to, advertising standards and regulations, ethical and responsible marketing practices, discriminatory practices against certain groups of customers, and misleading or deceptive labeling. It further addresses transparency of information and fair advice provided to customers and potential customers including, but not limited to, fees and penalties. The topic covers deceptive and aggressive selling practices where the incentive compensation structure of employees may result in the sale of products and services that are not in the best interest of clients.

%ile within SICS industry for a company derived from insight scores calculated from news articles relevant to Fair Disclosure and Labeling category of any company. This topic addresses transparency, accuracy, and comprehensibility of marketing statements, advertising, and labeling of products and services. It further addresses transparency of information and fair advice provided to customers and potential customers including, but not limited to, fees and penalties. The topic covers deceptive and aggressive selling practices where the incentive compensation structure of employees may result in the sale of products and services that are not in the best interest of clients.

fnd21_allcategories_insight_fairlaborpra.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to the Fair Labor Practices category of any company. This topic addresses management's ability to uphold commonly accepted labor standards in the workplace, including compliance with labor laws, internationally accepted norms, and standards. At a minimum, this includes ensuring basic human rights such as those outlined in ILO Standards related to child labor, forced or bonded labor, exploitative labor, fair wages and overtime pay, and other basic workers' rights. It also includes competitive and fair salaries, minimum wage policies, and provision of benefits, all of which may relate to how a workforce is attracted, retained, and incentivized to act in the interests of the company. This topic addresses management's relationship with organized labor and freedom of association.

%ile within SICS industry for a company derived from insight scores calculated from news articles relevant to Fair Labor Practices category of any company. This topic addresses management's ability to uphold commonly accepted labor standards in the workplace, including compliance with labor laws, internationally accepted norms and standards. At a minimum this includes ensuring basic human rights such as those outlined in ILO Standards related to child labor, forced or bonded labor, exploitative labor, fair wages and overtime pay, and other basic workers' rights. It also includes competitive and fair salaries, minimum wage policies, provision of benefits, all of which may relate to how a workforce is attracted, retained, and incentivized to act in the interests of the company. This topic addresses management's relationship with organized labor and freedom of association.

fnd21_allcategories_insight_fairmarketin.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to the Fair Marketing and Advertising category of any company. fnd21_allcategories_insight_ghgemissions.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to GHG Emissions category of any company. This topic describes the management of direct (Scope 1) greenhouse gas emissions, including that from fuel consumption at stationary and non-stationary sources, exposure to regulation associated with carbon emissions, and relates to measures to mitigate emissions.

fnd21_allcategories_insight_productpacka.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to Product Packaging category of any company. The topic addresses integrations of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in characteristics of primary products and services provided or sold by a company. It addresses reduction of environmental externalities created during product life cycle, including impact of packaging, distribution, resource intensity of products in their use-phase, and end-of-life impacts of products. For service providers, it captures services which help customers reduce environmental and social impacts of their operations and/or their exposure to ESG risks. The topic covers company's ability to address customer and societal demand for more sustainable products and services as well as ability to meet evolving environmental and social regulatory rules.

%ile within SICS industry for a company derived from insight scores calculated from news articles relevant to Product Packaging category of any company. The topic addresses integrations of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in characteristics of primary products and services provided or sold by a company. It addresses reduction of environmental externalities created during product life cycle, including impact of packaging, distribution, resource intensity of products in their use-phase, and end-of-life impacts of products. For service providers, it captures services which help customers reduce environmental and social impacts of their operations and/or their exposure to ESG risks. The topic covers company's ability to address customer and societal demand for more sustainable products and services as well as ability to meet evolving environmental and social regulatory rules.

fnd21_allcategories_insight_productquali.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to Product Quality and Safety category of any company. This topic addresses a company's ability to offer manufactured products and services that are safe, reliable, and of a high quality.

%ile within SICS industry for a company derived from insight scores calculated from news articles relevant to Product Quality and Safety category of any company. This topic addresses a company's ability to offer manufactured products and services that are safe, reliable, and of high quality.

fnd21_allcategories_insight_regulatoryca.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to Regulatory Capture and Political Influence category of any company. This topic addresses a company's strategy and reliance upon regulatory policy or monetary incentives (such as subsidies and taxes), its actions to influence industry policy (such as through lobbying), overall reliance on a favorable regulatory environment for business competitiveness, and ability to comply with relevant regulations. It may relate to the alignment between management's and investors' view of regulatory engagement and management of regulatory compliance at large.

%ile within SICS industry for a company derived from insight scores calculated from news articles relevant to the Regulatory Capture and Political Influence category of any company. This topic addresses a company's strategy and reliance upon regulatory policy or monetary incentives (such as subsidies and taxes), its actions to influence industry policy (such as through lobbying), overall reliance on a favorable regulatory environment for business competitiveness, and ability to comply with relevant regulations. It may relate to the alignment between management's and investors' view of regulatory engagement and management of regulatory compliance at large

fnd21_allcategories_insight_supplychainm.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to Supply Chain Management category of any company. This topic addresses the management of environmental, social, and governance risks within a company's supply chain. The supply chain is defined broadly and includes multiple tiers of suppliers from raw material suppliers to manufacturers of end products. It includes how companies screen, select, monitor, and engage with suppliers on environmental and social topics including environmental responsibility, human rights and labor practices, and ethics and corruption. The scope of the topic excludes issues related to impacts of climate change and other environmental and social factors on the availability and pricing of key resources.

Percentile within SICS industry for a company derived from insight scores calculated from news articles relevant to Supply Chain Management category of any company. This topic addresses the management of environmental, social, and governance risks within a company's supply chain. The supply chain is defined broadly and includes multiple tiers of suppliers from raw material suppliers to manufacturers of end products. It includes how companies screen, select, monitor, and engage with suppliers on environmental and social topics including environmental responsibility, human rights and labor practices, and ethics and corruption. The scope of the topic excludes issues related to impacts of climate change and other environmental and social factors on availability and pricing of key resources.

fnd21_allcategories_insight_waterandwast.description: Insight score derived from news articles relevant to Water and Waste Water Management category of any company. This topic addresses the management of water resources in manufacturing and/or for the provision of products and services. It addresses water availability, access, and scarcity; water efficiency, intensity, and recycling; competition for water resources; wastewater discharge, including groundwater and aquifer pollution; and regulatory aspects related to water management.

%ile within SICS industry for a company derived from insight scores calculated from news articles relevant to the Water and Waste Water Management category of any company. This topic addresses the management of water resources in manufacturing and/or for the provision of products and services. It addresses water availability, access, and scarcity; water efficiency, intensity, and recycling; competition for water resources; wastewater discharge, including groundwater and aquifer pollution; and regulatory aspects related to water management

fnd21_allcategories_momentum_customerwel.description: Trend measure derived from news articles relevant to the Customer Welfare category of any company. This topic addresses a company's ability to provide consumers manufactured products and services that are aligned with societal expectations of fairness, equity, and responsibility. It does not include issues directly related to quality and safety malfunctions of manufactured products and services, but instead addresses qualities inherent to the design and delivery of products and services where customer welfare may be a concern. This includes issues such as customer demand for products and services with health and well-being outcomes and ensuring supply chain integrity from counterfeit products.

fnd21_allcategories_momentum_materiality.description: Trend measure derived from news articles relevant to all material categories of any company.

fnd21_allcategories_momentum_materialsso.description: Trend measure derived from news articles relevant to the Materials Sourcing category of any company. This topic relates to the integration of natural resource scarcity considerations into a company's approach to sourcing materials as well as into product design and manufacturing. It relates to materials supply chain resilience to impacts of climate change and other environmental and social factors impacting the availability and pricing of key resources. Approaches to management of the topic include the use of recycled and renewable raw materials, reducing the use of key materials (dematerialization), maximizing resource efficiency in manufacturing, and R&D investments in substitute materials. It also includes the integration of resource scarcity considerations into product end-of-life management through take-back programs and material recovery. The scope of the topic excludes issues associated with screening, selection, and management of suppliers based on their environmental and social performance.

%ile within SICS industry for a company derived from momentum scores calculated from news articles relevant to Materials Sourcing category of any company. This topic relates to the integration of natural resource scarcity considerations into a company's approach to sourcing of materials as well as into product design and manufacturing. It relates to materials supply chain resilience to impacts of climate change and other environmental and social factors impacting availability and pricing of key resources. Approaches to management of the topic include the use of recycled and renewable raw materials, reducing the use of key materials (dematerialization), maximizing resource efficiency in manufacturing, and R&D investments in substitute materials. It also includes integration of resource scarcity considerations into product end-of-life management through take-back programs and material recovery. The scope of the topic excludes issues associated with screening, selection, and management of suppliers based on their environmental and social performance.

For service providers, it captures services which help customers reduce environmental and social impacts of their operations and/or their exposure to ESG risks. The topic covers company's ability to address customer and societal demand for more sustainable products and services as well as ability to meet evolving environmental and social regulatory rules.

Percentile within SICS industry for a company derived from momentum scores calculated from news articles relevant to Product Packaging category of any company. The topic addresses integrations of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in characteristics of primary products and services provided or sold by a company. It addresses reduction of environmental externalities created during product life cycle, including, impact of packaging, distribution, resource intensity of products in their use-phase, and end-of-life impacts of products. For service providers, it captures services which help customers reduce environmental and social impacts of their operations and/or their exposure to ESG risks. The topic covers company's ability to address customer and societal demand for more sustainable products and services as well as ability to meet evolving environmental and social regulatory rules.

fnd21_allcategories_momentum_productqual.description: Trend measure derived from news articles relevant to the Product Quality and Safety category of any company. This topic addresses a company's ability to offer manufactured products and services that are safe, reliable, and of high quality.

%ile within SICS industry for a company derived from momentum scores calculated from news articles relevant to the Product Quality and Safety category of any company. This topic addresses a company's ability to offer manufactured products and services that are safe, reliable, and of high quality.

fnd21_allcategories_momentum_regulatoryc.description: Trend measure derived from news articles relevant to Regulatory Capture and Political Influence category of any company. This topic addresses a company's strategy and reliance upon regulatory policy or monetary incentives (such as subsidies and taxes), its actions to influence industry policy (such as through lobbying), overall reliance on a favorable regulatory environment for business competitiveness, and ability to comply with relevant regulations. It may relate to the alignment between management's and investors' view of regulatory engagement and management of regulatory compliance at large

%ile within SICS industry for a company derived from momentum scores calculated from news articles relevant to Regulatory Capture and Political Influence category of any company. This topic addresses a company's strategy and reliance upon regulatory policy or monetary incentives (such as subsidies and taxes), its actions to influence industry policy (such as through lobbying), overall reliance on a favorable regulatory environment for business competitiveness, and ability to comply with relevant regulations. It may relate to the alignment between management's and investors' view of regulatory engagement and management of regulatory compliance at large

fnd21_allcategories_momentum_supplychain.description: Trend measure derived from news articles relevant to Supply Chain Management category of any company. This topic addresses the management of environmental, social, and governance risks within a company's supply chain. The supply chain is defined broadly and includes multiple tiers of suppliers from raw material suppliers to manufacturers of end products. It includes how companies screen, select, monitor, and engage with suppliers on environmental and social topics including environmental responsibility, human rights and labor practices, and ethics and corruption. The scope of the topic excludes issues related to impacts of climate change and other environmental and social factors on availability and pricing of key resources.

%ile within SICS industry for a company derived from momentum scores calculated from news articles relevant to Supply Chain Management category of any company. This topic addresses the management of environmental, social, and governance risks within a company's supply chain. The supply chain is defined broadly and includes multiple tiers of suppliers from raw material suppliers to manufacturers of end products. It includes how companies screen, select, monitor, and engage with suppliers on environmental and social topics including environmental responsibility, human rights and labor practices, and ethics and corruption. The scope of the topic excludes issues related to impacts of climate change and other environmental and social factors on availability and pricing of key resources.

fnd21_allcategories_momentum_wasteandhaz.description: Trend measure derived from news articles relevant to Waste and Hazardous Materials Management category of any company. This topic addresses the management of solid wastes, both hazardous and nonhazardous, in manufacturing, agriculture, and other industrial processes. It addresses treatment, handling, storage, disposal, and regulatory compliance. It does not address emissions to air or wastewater. It does not include waste from end-of-life of products

%ile within SICS industry for a company derived from momentum scores calculated from news articles relevant to Waste and Hazardous Materials Management category of any company. This topic addresses the management of solid wastes, both hazardous and nonhazardous, in manufacturing, agriculture, and other industrial processes. It addresses treatment, handling, storage, disposal, and regulatory compliance. It does not address emissions to air or wastewater. It does not include waste from end-of-life of products.

fnd21_allcategories_momentum_waterandwas.description: Trend measure derived from news articles relevant to Water and Waste Water Management category of any company. This topic addresses the management of water resources in manufacturing and/or for the provision of products and services. It addresses water availability, access, and scarcity; water efficiency, intensity, and recycling; competition for water resources; wastewater discharge, including groundwater and aquifer pollution; and regulatory aspects related to water management.

Percentile within SICS industry for a company derived from momentum scores calculated from news articles relevant to Water and Wastewater Management category of any company. This topic addresses the management of water resources in manufacturing and/or for the provision of products and services. It addresses water availability, access, and scarcity; water efficiency, intensity, and recycling; competition for water resources; wastewater discharge, including groundwater and aquifer pollution; and regulatory aspects related to water management.

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_accessandaffor.description: Short-term, real-time performance score derived from news articles relevant to the Access and Affordability category for any company. This news topic addresses companies' ability to ensure equal access to their products and services and that products and services are priced fairly, in particular in the context of underserved markets. Issues include those related to universal needs such as access to health care, financial services, education, and telecommunications

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_accidentandsaf.description: Short-term, real-time performance measuring pulse score derived from news articles relevant to Accident and Safety Management Category of any company. This topic addresses the corporate use of management systems and scenario planning to identify and understand exposure to possible catastrophic risks and prevent the occurrence of low probability, high-impact accidents and emergencies. It relates to the culture of safety at a company, management systems and technological controls, potential human safety, environmental health, and social implications of these events occurring, and the long-term effects on an organization, its workers, and society should these events occur.

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_allcategories_.description: Short-term, real-time performance pulse score derived from news articles relevant to all the ESG categories of any company.

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_biodiversityim.description: Short-term, real-time performance pulse score derived from news articles relevant to Biodiversity Impact of any company. This topic addresses impacts on ecosystems and biodiversity. This includes, but is not limited to, aspects of land use, ecosystem service benefits, biodiversity loss and habitat destruction, and deforestation. This topic relates to all stages of a company's interaction with ecosystems including planning, land acquisition, permitting, development, operations, and site remediation

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_businessethics.description: Short-term, real-time performance pulse score derived from news articles relevant to Business Ethics and Transparency of Payments category of any company. This topic relates to risks and opportunities surrounding ethical conduct of business, including fraud, corruption, bribery and facilitation payments, fiduciary responsibilities, and other illegal behavior that may have an ethical component. This includes sensitivity to business norms and standards as they shift over time, jurisdiction, and culture

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_competitivebeh.description: Short-term, real-time performance pulse score derived from news articles relevant to Competitive Behavior category of any company. This topic addresses the management of legal and social expectation around monopolistic practices, bargaining power, collusion, price fixing and manipulation, and patent and IP protection.

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_datasecurityan.description: Short-term, real-time performance pulse score derived from news articles relevant to the Data Security and Customer Privacy category of any company. This topic addresses risks related to a company's management of sensitive, confidential, and/or proprietary data. This includes the safekeeping of customer data. It relates to technology practices, training, record keeping, cooperation with law enforcement, and other mechanisms used to ensure privacy and security.

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_diversityandin.description: Short-term, real-time performance pulse score derived from news articles relevant to Diversity and Inclusion category of any company. The topic addresses diversity and inclusion practices as it applies to hiring, employing, and promoting in the workplace. It covers the issues of discriminatory practices on the bases of race, gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, and other factors

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_employeehealth.description: Short-term, real-time performance pulse score derived from news articles relevant to Employee Health Safety and Well Being category of any company. This topic addresses a company's ability to maintain a safe and healthy workplace environment. This includes creating a workplace free of injuries, fatalities, and illness (both chronic and acute, and physical and mental health) through technology, training, corporate culture, regulatory compliance, monitoring and testing, and personal protective equipment

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_energymanageme.description: Short-term, real-time performance pulse score derived from news articles relevant to Energy Management category of any company. This topic addresses indirect (Scope 2) greenhouse gas emissions through management of the use of energy in manufacturing and/or for the provision of products and services. It includes energy efficiency and intensity, energy mix, grid reliance, and other factors.

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_fairdisclosure.description: Short-term, real-time performance pulse score derived from news articles relevant to Fair Disclosure and Labeling category of any company. This topic addresses transparency, accuracy, and comprehensibility of marketing statements, advertising, and labeling of products and services. This includes, but is not limited to, advertising standards and regulations, ethical and responsible marketing practices, discriminatory practices against certain groups of customers, and misleading or deceptive labeling. It further addresses transparency of information and fair advice provided to customers and potential customers including, but not limited to, fees and penalties. The topic covers deceptive and aggressive selling practices where incentive compensation structure of employees may result in the sale of products and services that are not in the best interest of clients.

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_fairlaborpract.description: Short-term, real-time performance pulse score derived from news articles relevant to the Fair Labor Practices category of any company. This topic addresses management's ability to uphold commonly accepted labor standards in the workplace, including compliance with labor laws, internationally accepted norms, and standards. At a minimum, this includes ensuring basic human rights such as those outlined in ILO Standards related to child labor, forced or bonded labor, exploitative labor, fair wages and overtime pay, and other basic workers' rights. It also includes competitive and fair salaries, minimum wage policies, and provision of benefits, all of which may relate to how a workforce is attracted, retained, and incentivized to act in the interests of the company. This topic addresses management's relationship with organized labor and freedom of association.

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_fairmarketinga.description: Short-term, real-time performance pulse score derived from news articles relevant to Fair Marketing and Advertising category of any company. This topic addresses transparency, accuracy, and comprehensibility of marketing statements, advertising, and labeling of products and services. This includes, but is not limited to, advertising standards and regulations, ethical and responsible marketing practices, discriminatory practices against certain groups of customers, and misleading or deceptive labeling. It further addresses transparency of information and fair advice provided to customers and potential customers including, but not limited to, fees and penalties. The topic covers deceptive and aggressive selling practices where the incentive compensation structure of employees may result in the sale of products and services that are not in the best interest of clients.

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_ghgemissions_p.description: Short-term, real-time performance pulse score derived from news articles relevant to GHG Emissions category of any company. This topic describes the management of direct (Scope 1) greenhouse gas emissions, including that from fuel consumption at stationary and non-stationary sources, exposure to regulation associated with carbon emissions, and relates to measures to mitigate emissions.

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_lifecycleimpac.description: Short-term, real-time performance pulse score derived from news articles relevant to the Lifecycle Impact of Products and Services category of any company.

fnd21_allcategories_pulse_materiality_pu.description: Short-term, real-time performance pulse score derived from news articles relevant to all material categories of any company.
